question: For the first time in the year 2020, April 14 has been observed as which year by the World Health Organisation?
explanation:
For the first time in the year 2020, April 14 has been celebrated as World Chagas Day by the World Health Organisation.
In May 2019, the decision-making body of the World Health Organisation, the World Health Assembly announced that April 14 would be observed as World Chagas Day, to create awareness about the infectious disease, caused by parasites. On the same day in 1909, the first patient of this disease was diagnosed.
